Although Eric Schmidt said that he was happy with Google's decision to stop co-operating with China over censorship in March last year, he added: Over time I would hope, especially in my new role with more of an external focus, that I can try to get more of Google, appropriately and within our policies, into China. It was revealed earlier this month that fifty-five-year-old Eric Schmidt would make way as chief executive for Larry Page, 37, who co-founded Google with Sergey Brin . However, he suggested that Henry Louis Gates should not have argued with the policeman arresting him. You don't argue with a police officer, he says. ''People expect that we can create a modern, liberal democracy in Afghanistan,'' Donald Rumsfeld explains, but that ignores the realities of a landlocked country with a history and culture of its own. A liberated people have been given a chance to install a representative government that fits with their own culture, but we have a limited ability to impose any lasting outcomes otherwise.
